6 cups soft bread crumbs
1 1/2 cups milk
4 eggs
3 pounds ground beef (90% lean or better)
1 pound ground pork (Jimmy Dean's Hot Sausage works great)
2 finely chopped onions  or equivalent in minced onions
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 cup ketchup
recipeText:
Soak bread in milk. (I sometimes don't use milk.  The grease from the meat makes it wet enough.)  

Add eggs and beat with rotary beater or mix by hand.  

Add meat, onion, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup catsup.  Form into 4 loaves.  Place in loaf pan or 13x9x2 inch baking pan.  

Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. 

Spread the rest of the catsup over top of loaves and bake extra 15 minutes.

ingredientList:
6 cups soft bread crumbs
1 1/2 cups milk
4 eggs
3 pounds ground beef (90% lean or better)
1 pound ground pork (Jimmy Dean's Hot Sausage works great)
2 finely chopped onions
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 cup ketchup
1 flaxseed, as desired
.
DO NOT ADD CARROTS - you can taste the carrots
recipeText:
Soak bread in milk.  Add eggs and beat with rotary beater.  Add meat, onion, celery, Worcestershire sauce, salt, pepper, and 1/4 cup catsup.  

Form into 4 loaves for 16 servings.  Place in loaf pan or 13x9x2 inch baking pan.  

Bake, uncovered at 350 degrees for 1 hour. 

Spread the rest of the catsup over top of loaves and bake extra 15 minutes.

recipeDescription:
Dylan didn't like at all. 
Ken and Melissa think it is good for variety.
Kailey likes it better than meatloaf.
ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1/4 cup chopped onions
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 loaf french bread
Butter, softened
1 cup sour cream
1 tomato, seeded and diced
1/2 green pepper, diced
1 1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
recipeText:
In a skillet, brown ground beef and onion.  Drain.  Stir in salt, garlic powder, and pepper.

Cut bread lengthwise in half.  Butter both halfs of the bread and place on cookie sheets.

Add sour cream to meat mixture; spoon onto bread halves.

Sprinkle with tomatoes and green pepper; top with cheese.

Bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Bake longer for crispier bread.

ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1 package taco seasoning mix
1 package spanish rice and sauce mix
1 can pinto beans
1 package flour tortillas
2 cups lettuce, shredded
2 medium tomatoes, diced
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1 cup shredded Monterey Jack-Colby cheese
1/2 cup sour cream
Salsa
recipeText:
Prepare ground beef with taco seasoning as directed on the seasoning package.  Cook Spanish rice as directed on package.  Heat pinto beans.

Create a burrito using ingredients as desired.

recipeDescription:
Prep Time: Ready in 8 to 9 hours
Ken would eat this twice a month.
ingredientList:
8 pork chops
1/4 cup olive oil
1/4 teaspoon salt, to taste
1/4 teaspoon pepper, to taste
1 large onion, sliced 1/4-inch thick
2 cubes chicken bouillon
2 cups hot water
1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese
recipeText:
1. Season pork chops to taste.

2. Lightly brown pork chops in oil and place in crock-pot. Top pork chops with onion slices in the crock-pot.

3. Dissolve bouillon in hot water and pour over chops.

4. Cook on low 7 to 8 hours.

5. After the pork chops have cooked, stir cream cheese into the cooking juices. Turn crock-pot to high for about 30 minutes or until liquid is slightly thickened.

recipeDescription: Bourbon-Maple Whipped Cream
ingredientList:
1 1/4 cups very cold heavy cream
2 tablespoons Grade B maple syrup
1 to 2 tablespoons bourbon (to your taste)
1/2 vanilla bean, split, seeds scraped and reserved
recipeText:
1. For the whipped cream:
2. Combine the cream, vanilla seeds, syrup and bourbon in a large chilled bowl and whip until soft peaks form.
3. Garnish each piece of pie with a dollop of the whipped cream before serving.

recipeDescription: There are healthier ways to get your fill of pumpkin than by eating pumpkin pie -- like this pumpkin pudding recipe.
ingredientList:
1/4 - 1/2 cup sugar
2 - 4 teaspoons cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ginger
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
2 large eggs
15 ounces can pure pumpkin
12 ounces can evaporated milk (nonfat)
recipeText:
Mix all the ingredients together and pour the mixture into an 8-by-8-inch casserole. 

Bake it in a preheated 350 degree oven for about 30 minutes. 

Don't overbake; the center should be slightly wiggly. Cool and enjoy, or refrigerate for later use.

Pumpkin is also a good source of potassium, magnesium, fiber, and antioxidant vitamins C and E.
The phenols in pumpkin may help keep blood vessels relaxed, which means better blood pressure and better heart health.

ingredientList:
2 cups Original Bisquick
1/2 cup white chocolate chips
1/3 cup sugar
2/3 cup milk
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
1 egg
1 cup raspberries
recipeText:
1. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease bottoms only of 12 medium muffin cups, 2 1/2 x 1 1/4 inches or line with paper baking cups.

2. Stir all ingredients except raspberries in large bowl just until moistened. Fold in raspberries. Divide batter evenly among cups.

3. Bake 15 to 18 minutes or until golden brown. Cool slightly; remove from pan to wire rack.

HIGH ALTITUDE (3500 to 6500 feet): Bake 16 to 19 minutes.



*For a sweet finish: dip muffin tops into melted butter and then into coarse sugar crystals or granulated sugar. 
*Another dazzler: drizzle the tops with melted white baking chips.

recipeDescription: From my 4th grade cookbook.  Contributed by Jodi Geiger.
ingredientList:
1 cup margarine
1 cup brown sugar
1 cup sugar
2 eggs
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups rolled oats
2 cups crispy rice cereal
1 cup coconut
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together.  Drop by spoonful on cookie sheet.  

Bake at 350 degrees for 8 - 13 minutes.

recipeDescription: From my 4th grade cookbook.  Contributed by Andy Erickson & Dayton Larson.
ingredientList:
1 cup sugar
1 cup corn syrup
1 cup peanut butter
6 cups crispy rice cereal
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 cup butterscotch chips
recipeText:
Combine sugar and syrup.  

Cook over moderate heat, stirring frequently until it begins to bubble.  

Remove from heat and stir in peanut butter.  Add cereal.  

Press into buttered 13" x 9" pan.

recipeName: Smoky Moe's Sour Cream Vanilla Cheesecake
recipeDescription: Got this recipe from Smoky Moe's in Winter Park.  The recipe wasn't complete (dash of this, dash of that), so I combined a few recipes to come up with what I thought the right amounts should be.  The crust might be too much, but I used the amounts from another recipe and didn't take the time to figure out a reduction.
ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup melted butter
1 teaspoon cinnamon
3 8-ounce packages cream cheese, softened
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
4 eggs
1 1/2 cups sour cream
3 tablespoons sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Combine crumbs, 1/4 cup sugar, melted butter, and dash of cinnamon.  Press firmly into bottom of pie pan.  

Beat cream cheese with 1 cup sugar, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and eggs until smooth.  Pour into crust.  Bake at approximately 400 degrees for about 30 minutes.

Mix sour cream, 3 tablespoons of sugar, and 1 teaspoon of vanilla.  Pour over baked cheesecake.  Bake at approximately 475 degrees for 5 - 10 minutes or until top turns a light brown.

recipeDescription:
http://tastykitchen.com/blog/2010/03/a-tasty-recipe-thats-the-best-frosting-ive-ever-had/
So perfect on a chocolate cake that you'll never frost one with anything else, ever again.
ingredientList:
5 tablespoons flour
1 cup milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup butter (only use real butter)
1 cup granulated sugar (not powdered sugar!)
recipeText:
In a small saucepan, whisk flour into milk and heat, stirring constantly, until it thickens. 
You want it to be very thick, thicker than cake mix, more like a brownie mix is. 

Remove from heat and let it cool to room temperature. 
(If I'm in a hurry, I place the saucepan over ice in the sink for about 10 minutes or so until the mixture cools.) 

It must be completely cool before you use it in the next step. Stir in vanilla.

While the mixture is cooling, cream the butter and sugar together until light and fluffy. 
You don't want any sugar graininess left. 
Then add the completely cooled milk/flour/vanilla mixture and beat the living daylights out of it. 

If it looks separated, you haven't beaten it enough! Beat it until it all combines and resembles whipped cream.

If you taste flour or paste when it's done, I suspect the flour/milk mixture didn't cook long enough. 
Don't be in a hurry to bring the milk/flour to the thickened state, let it have time to cook that flour taste out as it thickens. 

Did you get lumps? whisk whisk whisk as it cooks! 

Some people use 3 Tablespoons of flour instead of 5. Can be made it with soy milk, non-fat milk, or half-n-half. 

Some have recommendations for adding cocoa powder, cherry, fresh strawberries, etc.

ingredientList:
1 pound empty can with plastic lid
3 pounds empty can with plastic lid
1 1/2 cups rock or kosher salt
20 cups crushed ice (7-1/2 lbs)
1 cup heavy cream
1 cup milk
1/2 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/3 cup semi-sweet mini chocolate chips
recipeText:
In the small can mix cream, milk, sugar, vanilla, and chocolate chips. 

Cover the small can and set in the center of the larger can. 

Layer half the crushed ice alternately with half the salt in the empty space between the cans. 

Cover the larger can. 

Now the fun begins: Choose a hard level surface like a cement walk way and roll the can back and forth for about 10 minutes. 

Open outer can; empty old ice and water, lift out small can; wipe lid dry and remove. With a rubber spatula scrape ice cream from can sides. Stir and cover. 

Return small can. Repack with remaining ice and salt. Cover and roll for 5 more minutes. 
Recipe formatted with the Cook'n Grocery List Software from DVO Enterprises.

recipeName: White Chocolate Cheesecake with White Chocolate Brandy Sauce
ingredientList:
4 1-ounce squares white chocolate
3 8-ounce packages cream cheese
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup flour
3 eggs
1 1/2 cups heavy cream
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups finely chopped white chocolate
2 fluid ounces brandy
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 300 degrees.  Wrap the outside of a 10 inch springform pan with foil. Grease the inside of the pan. 

Place the cream cheese, sugar, and flour in a mixing bowl and cream until light and fluffy. Beat in eggs one at a time, mixing well after each addition. Scrape bowl. 

Melt 4 ounces of the white chocolate. With an electric mixer on low speed, mix melted white chocolate into cream cheese mixture. Keeping electric mixer on low, slowly beat in the vanilla and 1/2 cup of heavy cream. Blend well. Pour mixture into the prepared springform pan. 

Place cheesecake pan in a water bath filled with warm water. Bake at 300 degrees for 50 to 60 minutes, or until center of the cheesecake is just firm. Cool at room temperature for 1 hour. Refrigerate until set before removing from pan. 

To make White Chocolate Brandy Sauce: Place 1 cup heavy cream in a saucepan and bring to a boil. Watch carefully so it doesn't boil over. Pour hot cream over 2 cups of finely chopped white chocolate and stir with a wooden spoon until melted. Add brandy and continue stirring until incorporated. Pour over chilled cheesecake and serve.

ingredientList:
1 box devil's food cake mix
1 15-ounce can pure pumpkin
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 400 degrees. 

Mix the two ingredients together. The mixture will be very thick, but don't add anything else! 

Place batter into a 12-cup muffin pan lined with baking cups or sprayed with nonstick spray. 

Place pan in the oven, and bake for 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 large bananas
1 1/2 cups almond milk
1/2 cup vanilla yogurt
1 teaspoon honey
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 dash nutmeg
2 cups ice
recipeText: Blend until smooth.  For a nicer consistency, freeze bananas and use less ice.

ingredientList:
4 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup confectioners' sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 egg, beaten, divided
1 pkg (17.3 oz each) frozen puff pastry sheets, thawed (see Puff Pastry recipes)
1 21-ounce can pie filling (Cherry, Blueberry, Raspberry, Apple)

ICING:
1/2 cup confectioners' sugar
2 tablespoons heavy (whipping) cream or milk
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
1. Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Place cream cheese, 1/4 cup confectioners sugar, 1/2 teaspoon of vanilla and 2 tablespoons beaten egg in a medium bowl. Beat with an electric mixer on low speed until smooth.

2. Place a large sheet of parchment paper down on a work surface. Place puff pastry on parchment and unfold sheets so they are touching end to end and form a roughly 9-1/2x18-inch rectangle. Spread cream cheese mixture down the center leaving 3 inches on each side. Spoon cherry pie filling over cream cheese.

3. Cut 1-inch wide diagonal slits on each side of the filling about 3-inches in length. Fold strips on one side over onto filling. Brush with beaten egg. Fold strips on the other side over filling. Gently shape the top into a candy cane.

4. Transfer candy cane on parchment to a large baking sheet. Brush the entire thing with beaten egg. Bake 30 to 35 minutes, until puffed and deeply browned. Cool.

5. Icing: Whisk together icing ingredients in a small bowl. Drizzle icing over cooled candy cane. Slice and serve.

recipeDescription: A simple & easy 6-ingredient recipe for homemade chai spice mix with cinnamon, ginger, cardamom, cloves, nutmeg, & allspice.
ingredientList:
3 tablespoons ground cinnamon
1 tablespoon ground cardamom
1 tablespoon ground ginger
1/2 tablespoon ground allspice
1/2 tablespoon ground cloves
1/2 tablespoon ground nutmeg
recipeText:
Add all listed ingredients to an airtight container or jar. Seal the jar, and shake to combine. 

Store on your spice rack, at room temperature, for up to 1 year.

recipeDescription: From Stacy Bertrang
ingredientList:
12 vanilla wafers
12 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
Whipped cream or cool whip
1 can of your favorite pie filling
recipeText:
Line twelve muffin cups with foil bake cups. Place one cookie in each. Set aside.

In large mixing bowl beat cream cheese, sugar and vanilla on medium speed of electric mixer until fluffy. Add eggs, one at a time, beating until just combined after each addition.

Carefully spoon about 1/4 cup cream cheese mixture into each bake cup. Bake at 350 degrees for 15 minutes.

Cool completely.  Leave in foil cups or peel away bake cups. Top with fruit and cool whip.  

Store in refrigerator.

recipeDescription: Smooth and creamy mousse is hidden within the easy-to-make candy shell. Set on a vibrant raspberry sauce, this dessert is dressed to impress.
ingredientList:
2 packages Dark Cocoa Candy Melts, divided
1 cup heavy whipping cream
1 package frozen raspberries in syrup, thawed
1/4 cup sour cream
Milk as needed
Chocolate curls (optional)
Fresh raspberries

Tools:
  Mini Ball Pan
  Pastry Brush
  Disposable Decorating Bags
  Toothpick
recipeText:
Melt 1 package Candy Melts according to package directions. Spoon melted candy into bottom of pan cavities.

With a clean pastry brush, spread candy up onto sides of pan, adding additional melted candy if needed to coat the sides well. Refrigerate 5 minutes.

Repeat with additional melted candy, continuing until candy forms a thin shell. Refrigerate until needed.

Chop remaining package of Candy Melts.

In medium saucepan or microwaveable bowl, heat whipping cream until hot (do not boil). Remove from heat; add chopped candy and stir until smooth and melted.

Let stand at room temperature 30 minutes. Cover and refrigerate until cold, about 1 hour.

With electric mixer, beat until just light and fluffy, being careful to not overbeat. Spoon into chocolate shells; smooth tops. Refrigerate until firm.

Make raspberry sauce. Place raspberries in blender or food processor; process until smooth. Strain to remove seeds. Refrigerate until ready to use.

To serve, make a pool of raspberry sauce on individual serving plates. Unmold bombes and place in center of raspberry sauce.

In small bowl, stir sour cream to soften and smooth; if necessary, stir in enough milk to achieve thin, smooth consistency.

Place into disposable decorating bag. Snip end of bag and pipe dots of mixture into raspberry sauce around bombe; pull points out with toothpick.

Garnish, if desired, with chocolate curls or fresh raspberries.

ingredientList:
12 ounces cream cheese, softened
3 tablespoons sour cream
1/2 cup powdered sugar
1 teaspoon pure vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
1 cup chopped strawberries
1/4 cup crushed graham crackers
15  popsicle sticks (depending on your ice cube tray)
recipeText:
In a large bowl using hand mixer, beat cream cheese, sour cream, powdered sugar, vanilla, and salt until smooth. Fold in strawberries. 

Spoon mixture into ice cube tray then sprinkle graham crackers on top. 

Insert a popsicle stick into the middle of each cheesecake cube. Freeze until the cheesecake mixture is solid. 

Remove from ice cube tray and serve immediately.

recipeDescription: This is a rich, dark chocolate topping that is shiny when cooled. It can be whipped as filling or just poured a cake.
ingredientList:
9 ounces bittersweet chocolate, chopped
1 cup heavy cream
1 tablespoon dark rum
recipeText:
Place the chocolate into a medium bowl. Heat the cream in a small sauce pan over medium heat. Bring just to a boil, watching very carefully because if it boils for a few seconds, it will boil out of the pot. When the cream has come to a boil, pour over the chopped chocolate, and whisk until smooth. Stir in the rum if desired. 

Allow the ganache to cool slightly before pouring over a cake. Start at the center of the cake and work outward. For a fluffy frosting or chocolate filling, allow it to cool until thick, then whip with a whisk until light and fluffy.

Add extra cream and use as dipping sauce for strawberries.

ingredientList:
7 ounces bittersweet chocolate
1/2 cup heavy cream
3 tablespoons butter
3 tablespoons brandy
recipeText: Melt chocolate, cream, butter or margarine, and brandy together until smooth. Allow to cool a little before spreading liberally over cake.

ingredientList:
2 cups heavy cream
1 1/4 pounds bittersweet chocolate
recipeText:
Chop the chocolate into small pieces and place it in a large stainless steel bowl. 

In a large, high sided saucepan, heat cream over medium high heat, stirring frequently, until it starts to boil. At this point, the cream will want to boil over, so keep an eye on it! Immediately remove from heat and pour over chopped chocolate. 

Stir until chocolate is completely melted and mixture is smooth. Cool completely and then store in refrigerator. 

Ganache can be reheated in a stainless steel bowl over hot, but not boiling, water.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups Oreo cookie crumbs
3 tablespoons melted butter
7 ounces caramels
1/4 cup evaporated milk
3/4 cup chopped pecans
6 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sour cream
1 1/4 cups milk
1 4-ounce package Jell-O Instant Chocolate Pudding and Pie Filling
1/4 cup fudge topping
recipeText:
Mix cookie crumbs and melted butter.  Press into a 9-in pie plate, bake at 350 degrees for 6 - 8 minutes.

Place caramels and evaporated milk in a saucepan.  Heat over medium-low heat, stirring continually until smooth (about 5 min).  Stir in 1/2 cup chopped pecans.  Pour into piecrust.  

Combine cream cheese, sour cream, and milk in a blender.  Process until smooth.  Add pudding mix; process for about 30 seconds longer.  

Pour pudding mixture over caramel layer, covering evenly.  Chill loosely covered, until set, about 15 minutes.  

Drizzle fudge topping over pudding layer (to decorate).  Sprinkle on remaining pecans.  Chill loosely covered until serving time.

recipeDescription:
Serves: Makes 18 kolaches
Hands On Time: 1 hour and 30 minutes
Total Time: 4 hours and 0 minutes
ingredientList:
DOUGH:
1 cup milk, heated to 105 to 115 degrees
1/4 cup sugar
2 1/4 teaspoons active dry yeast
3 cups all-purpose flour, plus more for kneading
12 tablespoons (3/4 cup) unsalted butter, melted and cooled, plus more for greasing
2 large eggs, beaten
2 teaspoons kosher salt

CREAM CHEESE FILLING:
8 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup sugar
1 large egg yolk
1/2 teaspoon vanilla
1/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/8 teaspoon ground nutmeg
Pinch salt

STREUSEL:
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
Pinch ground cinnamon
1 tablespoon unsalted butter, cubed, at room temperature
recipeText:
To make the dough: Grease a large bowl with butter. Line two baking sheets with parchment paper.

In a second large bowl, stir together the milk, sugar and yeast. Stir in 1 cup of the flour, cover lightly with plastic wrap, and let sit until very bubbly, about 40 minutes.

Stir 8 tablespoons (1/2 cup) of the butter and the eggs until smooth. Stir in the salt, followed by the remaining 2 cups flour, 1/2 cup at a time, until a sticky dough forms.

Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured counter and knead, adding more flour as needed, until the dough is elastic, just barely tacky, and springy to the touch, about 10 minutes. 
Transfer to the greased bowl, cover lightly with plastic wrap, and let sit until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Punch the dough down in the bowl. Turn the dough out onto a lightly floured counter and roll out to about 1/2 inch thick. 
Using a 2 1/2- to 3-inch biscuit cutter, cut the dough into 18 rounds. 
You will need to re-roll the dough once. Evenly spread the dough rounds out between the two prepared baking sheets. 
Cover lightly with plastic wrap and let sit until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Meanwhile, heat the oven to 375 degrees and make the filling and the streusel. 

To make the cream cheese filling: Using an electric mixer, beat the cream cheese and sugar on low speed until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes. 
Add the egg yolk, vanilla, cinnamon, nutmeg and salt. Continue to beat on low speed, scraping down the sides as necessary, until smooth, 2 to 3 minutes.

To make the streusel: In a medium bowl, stir together the flour, sugar and cinnamon. Cut the butter into the flour mixture and, using your hands, mix thoroughly to form a sandy meal.

Once the dough rounds have poofed, use your fingers to create an indentation in the center of each round, leaving a 1/2-inch border around the edges. 
Place about a tablespoon of filling in the center of each round. 
Brush the edges of the rounds with about half of the remaining melted butter and sprinkle with the streusel.

Bake until golden brown, 15 to 17 minutes. Brush the edges with the remaining butter and serve hot.

recipeDescription: From Nancy D.
ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine
1 cup sugar
1 egg
1 cup grated zucchini
2 cups flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
1/2 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Bake at 350 degrees for 8-12 minutes.
 
optional: 1/4 cup chopped nuts and 1/2 tsp nutmeg

ingredientList:
1 1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup margarine, melted
16 ounces cream cheese, softened
14 ounces sweetened condensed milk
3 eggs
1/4 cup lemon juice
1 cup pureed strawberries
recipeText:
Combine crumbs, sugar, and margarine; press firmly into bottom on 9-inch pie pan.  

Beat cream cheese until fluffy.  Gradually beat in sweetened condensed milk until smooth.  Add eggs and lemon juice.  Mix well.  Pour into prepared pan.   

Bake at 300 degrees for 50 - 55 minutes, or until center is set.  Cool, chill.  Garnish with strawberry puree.  Refrigerate leftovers.

ingredientList:
Crust:
30 small ginger snaps cookies (about 7 1/2 ounces)
2 tablespoons raisins
1 tablespoon canola oil

Filling:
1 cup canned pure pumpkin
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
2 pints (4 cups) frozen low-fat vanilla ice cream
recipeText:
1. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Coat a 9-inch deep-dish pie pan with cooking spray.

2. To prepare crust: Combine gingersnaps and raisins in a food processor and pulse until finely chopped. Add oil and pulse until blended. Press evenly into the bottom and up the sides of the prepared pan.

3. Bake the crust until set, about 10 minutes. Transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.

4. To prepare filling: Combine pumpkin, sugar, cinnamon, ginger and nutmeg in a large bowl and mix well. Add ice cream and stir until blended. Spoon the mixture into the cooled pie crust. Freeze until firm, at least 2 hours. Let the pie soften slightly in the refrigerator for 20 to 30 minutes before serving.

Tips & Notes

    * Make Ahead Tip: Cover and freeze the pie for up to 3 days. | Equipment: 9-inch deep-dish pie pan

    * Tip: To soften ice cream quickly, microwave on Medium-Low for 30 to 60 seconds.

ingredientList:
3 tablespoons tapioca
1 cup water
1/2 cup sugar
6 ounces frozen orange juice concentrate
1 box frozen strawberries
16 ounces pineapple tidbits (with juice)
1 can mandarin oranges, drained
1 can mixed fruits, drained
recipeText:
Cook tapioca, water, and sugar until thick, then add the other ingredients.

Chill.  Serve in sherbet glass with a dab of whipped cream.

ingredientList:
4 1/2 cups cake flour
4 cups sugar
2 teaspoons salt
2 cups boiling water
16 egg whites
2 tablespoons baking powder
2 teaspoons cream of tartar
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 teaspoon almond extract
recipeText:
Sift cake flour, sugar, and salt three times then stir in the boiling water. Let cool.

Beat egg whites, cream of tartar, baking powder, vanilla and almond flavorings until stiff peaks form. Fold into the flour mixture and pour batter into one ungreased 12x18 inch baking pan.

Bake at 350 degrees for 35 minutes. Cool cake inverted in pan, laying a tea towel underneath the cake to absorb the steam. Frost as desired once the cake is cooled.

ingredientList:
1 graham cracker pie crust
8 ounces cream cheese, softened
1/3 cup sugar
1 cup sour cream
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
8 ounces cool whip
Fresh strawberries
recipeText:
Beat cheese until smooth, gradually add sugar.  Blend in sour cream and vanilla.  Fold in whipped topping, blending well.  

Spoon into crust.  Chill until set, at least 4 hours.  Garnish with strawberries as desired.

ingredientList:
2 tablespoons peanut butter
1/2 cup lowfat milk
1 banana
1 teaspoon honey
1/2 cup ice cubes
recipeText:
Blend the peanut butter and milk together for about 5 seconds.

Add banana, hone, and ice cubes; blend until smooth.

recipeDescription:
Serving Size: 1 slice
Preparation Time: 20 minutes 
Total Time: 2 hours 5 minutes
ingredientList:
1/2 cup margarine or butter, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1 egg
1 teaspoon almond extract
1 cup ground almonds* 
1 tablespoon all-purpose flour
1 (29-ounce) can pear halves, well drained
1 graham cracker pie crust
recipeText:
1. In small mixing bowl beat margarine or butter and sugar with electric mixer on medium speed until combined. Add egg and almond extract. Beat until fluffy. Beat in almonds and flour until combined.

2. Use paper towels to pat pear halves dry. Cut 4 pear halves into 1/2-inch-thick slices. Place on bottom of crust. Arrange remaining pear halves, cut side down, on top of sliced pears. Carefully spread almond mixture over pears.

3. Bake at 350 degrees F for 40 to 45 minutes or until light brown. Cool on wire rack for 1 hour.

4. Garnish as desired. Store in refrigerator.

*NOTE: To grind almonds, place 4 ounces slivered almonds in food processor bowl or blender container. Cover and process until finely ground.

ingredientList:
1 3/4 cups all-purpose flour 
1/3 cup packed brown sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1 pinch salt
1/3 cup butter, chilled
1 egg 
1/2 cup half-and-half cream
1 cup chopped pear
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

Sift together the flour, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt in a large bowl; cut in the butter until the mixture has a crumbly texture. 

Whisk together the egg and half-and-half in a separate bowl; stir the egg mixture into the flour mixture until combined; stir in the pear. Drop large spoonfuls of the dough onto an ungreased baking sheet.

Bake in preheated oven until golden brown, about 15 minutes; rest briefly on a cooling rack before serving.

ingredientList:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 tablespoons granulated sugar
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup cold salted butter, cubed
1/2 cup crushed pineapple, drained
1/3 cup minced toasted sweetened flaked coconut
1 cup plus 1 tablespoon cold heavy whipping cream, divided
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Line a rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.

In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Using a pastry blender or 2 forks, cut in cold butter until it resembles coarse crumbs. Add pineapple and coconut, stirring to combine.

In a small bowl, combine 1 cup cold cream and vanilla extract. Add cream mixture to flour mixture, stirring until evenly moist. (If mixture seems dry, add more cream, 1 tablespoon at a time.) Working gently, bring mixture together with hands until a dough forms.

Turn out dough onto a lightly floured surface, and gently knead dough 3 to 4 times. Using a rolling pin, roll out dough to a 1/2-inch thickness. Using a 2 1/4-inch round cutter, cut 14 scones from dough, rerolling scraps as necessary. 

Place scones 2 inches apart on prepared baking sheet. Brush tops of scones with remaining 1 tablespoon cold cream.

Bake until edges of scones are golden brown and a wooden pick inserted in centers comes out clean, 18 to 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 cup butter, chilled
3/4 cup coconut milk
1/4 cup honey
1 egg, beaten
1 (8-ounce) can crushed pineapple, drained
1 orange, zested
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F.

In a medium bowl, mix flour, baking powder, and salt. Cut in chilled butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.

In a small bowl, mix coconut milk, honey, and egg. Stir into the flour mixture. Fold in pineapple and orange zest.

Divide the mixture into 12 rounded pieces, and arrange in a single layer on a medium ungreased baking sheet.

Bake 15 to 20 minutes in the preheated oven, until golden brown.

ingredientList:
2 1/3 cups flour
14 tablespoons frozen butter
Pinch salt
8 - 10 tablespoons chilled water
1 tablespoon lemon juice
recipeText:
Place your butter in the freezer for a minimum of 2 hours, but preferably overnight.

Mix together the water and lemon juice and set aside.

In a large bowl mix together the flour and salt. You need everything to be cold to yield great pastry, so feel free to put the bowl of flour in the fridge to chill.

On the larger side of a grater, grate the frozen butter directly into the flour mix. Stir the butter into the flour in with a knife. The colder the butter the flakier the pastry. 

So remember, this is a shortcut short crust pastry, so we aren't folding and doing that whole process. I'm all for process, but if you get a great result with less work, then I'm all for that too.

Add in the liquid, holding a little back just in case you don't need it all. Using your hand, bring your pastry together gently. You want to add just enough water to bring the pastry together. Too much water will not yield you a flaky dough.

Bring the dough together to form a ball. Wrap in cling film and place in the fridge for a minimum of 1 hour. You can refrigerate it for up to 3 days or freeze to use at a later day.

Note: Once you put pastry in the fridge and it relaxes it will get a little wetter so factor that in.

To use your pastry: Follow instructions required by the recipe you are making. Alway bake in a HOT oven for best results.

ingredientList:
(2 1/2 sticks) cold unsalted butter
1/2 cup cold tap water
1 teaspoon salt
2 cups unbleached, all-purpose flour
recipeText:
Cut 8 ounces (2 sticks) butter into 1/2 to 1/4-inch dice, place on a plate and refrigerate while preparing remaining ingredients.

Measure water and add salt; stir to dissolve and set aside.

Coarsely dice remaining 4 tablespoons (1/2 stick) butter. 

Place flour in work bowl of food processor fitted with metal blade; add 4 tablespoons butter and pulse until butter is absorbed -- about ten to twelve 1-second pulses.

Add remaining butter and pulse once or twice to distribute. Add water and pulse 3 or 4 times, just until dough forms a rough ball. Do not over-process.

Flour work surface and scrape dough from work bowl. Shape dough into a rough rectangle and place between 2 pieces of plastic wrap. 
	
Press dough with rolling pin to flatten, then roll back and forth several times with rolling pin to make a 12 by 18 inch rectangle of dough.

Peel away plastic wrap and invert dough to floured work surface. Peel away second piece of wrap. 

Fold dough in thirds in the width, folding the top third down and the bottom third up, to make a 6 by 18-inch rectangle, then roll up the dough from one of the 6-inch ends, making sure to roll end under dough. 

Press the dough into a square, wrap in plastic and refrigerate 1 hour, or until firm.

ingredientList:
1 8-ounce package cream cheese
1 15-ounce can pumpkins
1/2 cup brown sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 eggs
2 cups cool whip
1 1/2 teaspoons pumpkin pie spice
1 8" pie crust - graham cracker or vanilla wafer
recipeText:
Soften cream cheese to room temperature (about 30 seconds in microwave). Thoroughly combine cream cheese, 3/4 can pumpkin, brown sugar, vanilla and spices. Slowly add eggs to mixture. Beat well. Pour into crust. 

Bake at 350 degrees for 30-40 minutes or until center is set. Cool on rack one hour. 

Blend together the remaining 1/4 can pumpkin and cool whip. Spoon on top of pie. Chill several hours.

ingredientList:
1 9" graham cracker crust
2 8-ounce packages cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 cup canned pumpkin pie filling
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ginger
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
recipeText:
Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Place rack in the center position. 

Use a handheld mixer to blend the cream cheese and sugar until they are smooth. 

Add the eggs, pumpkin pie filling, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla. Mix or process until smooth. 

Take care not to beat too much air into the batter, or it will rise during baking and then fall and crack when it cools. 

Pour the mixture into the crust and bake the pie for 30 minutes or until the top looks dry, with only a small damp spot remaining in the center. Cool completely before serving, refrigerating or freezing.

recipeDescription: Prep Time: 35 minutes (ready in 1 hour 10 minutes)
ingredientList:
1/4 cup butter, softened
2 tablespoons chopped fresh parsley
1 tablespoon chopped green onions
1 teaspoon chopped fresh rosemary or 1/2 teaspoon dried rosemary leaves
1/4 teaspoon salt
dash pepper
2 garlic cloves, minced
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 cup unseasoned dry bread crumbs
1 egg
paprika 
Nonstick cooking spray
recipeText:
1. In small bowl, combine butter, parsley, onions, rosemary, salt, pepper and garlic mix well. Shape mixture into 3-inch log refrigerate until firm.

2. Heat oven to 350°F. Place 1 chicken breast half, boned side up, between 2 pieces of plastic wrap or waxed paper. Working from center, gently pound chicken with flat side of meat mallet or rolling pin until about 1/8 to 1/4 inch thick remove wrap. Repeat with remaining chicken breast halves.

3. Cut butter log crosswise into 4 equal pieces. Place 1 piece of butter on each chicken breast half. Fold in sides roll up jelly-roll fashion, pressing ends to seal. If necessary, secure with toothpicks.

4. Place flour and bread crumbs in separate shallow bowls. Place egg in another shallow bowl beat well. Coat chicken with flour dip in beaten egg. Roll chicken in bread crumbs place in ungreased 8-inch square (2-quart) baking dish. Sprinkle with paprika. Spray chicken rolls with nonstick cooking spray.

5. Bake at 350°F. for 30 to 35 minutes or until chicken is fork-tender and juices run clear.

ingredientList:
4 catfish fillets, thawed
1 cup prepared barbeque sauce
2 tablespoons lemon juice
2 tablespoons chopped green onion
2 tablespoons honey
1 tablespoon Worcestershire sauce
recipeText:
Rinse fillets and blot dry. 

Combine remaining ingredients and mix. Cut 4 pieces of heavy-duty aluminum foil, 12x12 inches each. 

Place each fillet in center of foil. Pour sauce equally over each fillet. 

Bring foil up and seal all edges with double folds. 

Place each foil package over grill. Cook over medium hot coals 15 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

Oven method: Cover fillets with sauce and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes.

ingredientList:
4 ounces salmon
7 ounces can stewed tomatoes
1/4 cup tomato puree
5 cloves garlic, roasted
1/2 scallion, thinly sliced
1 large mushroom , thinly sliced
1 teaspoon coriander
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
recipeText:
Place salmon skin side down in a nonstick pan.

Add the tomatoes, tomato puree, garlic, scallion, mushroom, and coriander, and cover.

Simmer over medium heat for about 15 minutes.

When salmon is done, remove from skillet onto plate, drizzling with lemon juice and garnishing with parsley.

ingredientList:
6 catfish fillets
1/2 cup butter
1 teaspoon minced parsley
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon chives
1/8 teaspoon cayenne pepper
salt and pepper to taste
recipeText:
Wash the catfish fillets and pat dry. Place the fillets in a very lightly buttered baking dish just large enough to hold them in one layer. Salt and pepper the fillets only slightly.

Melt the butter in a small saucepan and combine the remaining ingredients in the same pan. Rub each fillet with just a bit of the butter mixture. Broil the fish for about 5 minutes, without turning the fish over. Turn the broiler off and remove the pan from the oven. Cover each fillet with more of the chive butter and return the pan to the oven until you are ready to serve.

Serve the fillet over rice or pasta, with spoons full of the sauce from the pan.

ingredientList:
1 lb. catfish fillets

Sauce: 
1 tablespoon margarine
1/2 cup dry white wine
1 tablespoon fresh parsley, chopped
1/2 teaspoon fine herbs or bouquet garnish
(combine 3 tablespoons fennel seed, 1.5 teaspoons dried tarragon, 
3 teaspoons dried dill, 1.5 teaspoons pepper)
1 clove garlic, minced
recipeText:
To make sauce: Combine all sauce ingredients in a saucepan; heat slowly until margarine is melted. 

Place catfish fillets on broiler pan; brush with sauce. Broil about 4 inches from heat source for 5 minutes. Turn carefully; brush with sauce. Broil 5 minutes longer or until fish flakes when tested with a fork. Can be grilled instead of broiled.

ingredientList:
4 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
1 juice of lemon, divided
kosher salt
black pepper
1 teaspoon Italian seasoning or dried oregano
4 boneless skinless chicken breasts, pounded to even thickness
3 slicing tomatoes
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon freshly chopped basil
4 slices mozzarella cheese
freshly grated Parmesan cheese, for serving
recipeText:
Step 1
In a small bowl, combine oil, half the lemon juice, 1 teaspoon salt, 1/4 teaspoon pepper, and Italian seasoning (or oregano) and whisk to combine.
Transfer to a large re-sealable bag along with chicken; seal and refrigerate for 30 minutes.

Step 2
Heat grill over medium-high then add chicken, discarding excess marinade.
Grill until charred and cooked to an internal temperature of 155°-160°, about 5 to 7 minutes per side.

Step 3
Meanwhile, combine tomatoes, garlic, basil, and remaining lemon juice, and season with salt and pepper.

Step 4
While chicken is still on grill, top each breast with 1 slice mozzarella and cover until cheese is melted, 2 to 3 minutes.
Top chicken with tomato mixture.
Garnish with Parmesan and serve.

ingredientList:
2 boxes (4.7 oz each) Betty Crocker™ scalloped potatoes
4 cups boiling water
1 1/3 cups milk
1 package (8 oz) cream cheese, softened
2 cups cubed cooked chicken
1/4 cup Frank's™ RedHot™ Buffalo Wings Sauce
2 cups Progresso™ plain panko crispy bread crumbs
2 tablespoons butter
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
recipeText:
Heat oven to 375°F. Spray 13x9-inch (3-quart) glass baking dish with cooking spray.

On a stove-top, stir sauce mix, boiling water, and milk. Add potatoes and heat to boiling, stirring occasionally.

Reduce heat. Cover; simmer about 15 minutes, stirring often, until tender and sauce has thickened.

Stir in cream cheese, chicken and Buffalo wing sauce. Pour into baking dish.

In 10-inch skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat. Toast bread crumbs in butter about 5 minutes or until light golden brown. Stir in garlic powder. Sprinkle over chicken and potatoes.

Bake 12 to 15 minutes or until sauce is bubbling. Let stand 5 minutes before serving (sauce will thicken as it stands).

ingredientList:
2 pounds ground beef
1 10 3/4-ounce can condensed tomato soup
1 10 3/4-ounce can condensed mushroom soup
1 envelope dry onion soup mix
recipeText:
Shape beef into a loaf and freeze.  Place frozen loaf in a large piece of foil in a pan.

Pour soups and dry soup mix over it; seal tightly.

Bake at 300 degrees for 4 hours.

ingredientList:
1-1/2 pounds Catfish Fillets, cut into 1 inch pieces
2 tablespoons butter
1 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
2 garlic cloves, finely chopped
2 tablespoons fresh cilantro, chopped
1/2 pound smoked sausage, sliced thin
1 (10-3/4 ounce) can beef bouillon
1 bay leaf
2 cups water
2 tomatoes, coarsely chopped
1 cup uncooked rice
1 teaspoon hot pepper sauce
1 tablespoon fresh cilantro, chopped
recipeText:
Melt butter in heavy saucepan; add onion, pepper, garlic, 2 tablespoons cilantro and sausage. 

Saute until vegetables until tender. 

Add bouillon, bay leaf and water. 

Bring to a boil and simmer 20 minutes. 

Add catfish pieces, tomatoes, rice and pepper sauce. Bring to a boil again and simmer another 20 minutes. 

Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and serve.

ingredientList: Catfish Maitre D'
recipeText:
4 (8 oz.) Delta Pride catfish fillets
salt and pepper, to taste
� cup flour
� cup vegetable oil
� pound butter, melted
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1 tablespoon parsley - chopped

Season catfish fillets with salt and pepper; dredge in flour. Lightly brown on both sides in skillet with melted shortening. Remove from skillet and place in oven dish. Bake in 350� oven for 10 minutes. Meanwhile, have ready in small pot, butter and lemon juice. Remove fish from oven and place on serving platter. Bring lemon and butter mixture to a boil and stir. Add salt and pepper, to taste. Pour over the fillets and garnish with sliced lemon and curly leaf parsley.

ingredientList:
1/2 package linquini noodles
1 cup broccoli, cut into pieces
2 tablespoons butter
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breast halves, cubed
1 can cream of mushroom soup
1/2 cup milk
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/4 teaspoon pepper
recipeText:
Prepare linguine according to package directions.  Add broccoli for the last four minutes of cooking time.

In a skillet, melt butter.  Add chicken and cook until browned, stirring often.  Drain.

Add soup, milk, cheese, pepper and linguine mixture and cook through, stirring occasionally. Serve with additional parmesan cheese.

recipeDescription:
Tamara's recipe from Rad-dish
Handheld wraps filled with flavorful Asian Chicken and crunchy toppings.
ingredientList:
2 heads iceberg lettuce
2 carrots
1 red bell pepper
4 cloves garlic
1/2 teaspoon ginger
4 teaspoons lime juice
1/2 cup soy sauce
2 tablespoons rice vinegar
2 tablespoons brown sugar
4 teaspoons cornstarch
2 tablespoons vegetable oil
2 pounds ground chicken
8 green onions
2/3 cup chopped peanuts (optional)
recipeText:
Tear lettuce leaves away from core and make leaf cups.

Grate carrots and set aside.

Dice bell pepper and set aside.

Mix garlic, ginger, lime juice, soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, and corn starch.  Set aside.

Heat oil over medium-high heat.  Add chicken and cook until no longer pink.

Add sauce and bring to a boil.  Cook until thickened, 1 - 2 minutes.  

Thinly slice onions and stir into chicken mixture.

Scoop chicken into lettuce leaves.  Top with carrots, bell peppers, and peanuts.

ingredientList:
3 chicken breasts cut into pieces
1 (10-ounce) bag doritos
2 (10 3/4-ounce) cans cream of chicken soup
1 (10 3/4-ounce) can cream of mushroom soup
1 cup picante sauce
1/2 cup milk
2 cups Cheddar cheese
5 slices american cheese deluxe
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
recipeText:
Fry chicken with oil and about 2 TBSP of picante sauce. 

In a bowl mix soups, milk, chili powder, the rest of the picante sauce, and chicken. 

Spray 11x13pan with pam and layer chips, sauce, and cheese twice. 

Cover with foil and bake at 350 for 35-40 min.

ingredientList:
20 ounces boneless, skinless chicken breasts
1/2 teaspoon salt, divided
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup tapioca flour
1/3 cup olive oil
1/2 cup dry white wine
2 tablespoons fresh lemon juice
1/4 cup capers, drained
1/3 cup fresh chopped parsley
recipeText:
Lightly pound chicken between sheets of plastic wrap to about 1/4 inch thick.  
Pat chicken dry; season with 1/4 tsp salt and pepper. 
Dredge chicken in tapioca flour and shake off excess.

In a large skillet over medium heat, heat olive oil.  Add chicken and cook for 3 - 5 minutes per side, or until browned and cooked through.
Remove cooked chicken, transfer to a plate, and loosely cover with foil to keep warm.

In same skillet, add wine and lemon juice and deglaze skillet over medium heat by stirring and scraping up brown bits.
Simmer for 2 minutes until liquid reduces by about half.  
Add capers and remaining 1/4 tsp. salt and remove from heat.

Spoon sauce over cooked chicken and garnish with parsley.

Serve with herbed rice and steamed vegetables.

ingredientList:
2 cups chicken broth
2 small potatoes, peeled and diced
1 large carrot, peeled and sliced
1/2 cup celery, chopped
1/4 cup celery leaves
1 dash salt
1 dash pepper
recipeText:
Bring broth to a boil.  Add remaining ingredients and bring to boil.

Cover and simmer for 25 minutes.

Pour into a blender and liquify.

ingredientList:
2 cups corkscrew noodles
1 pound ground beef
3/4 cup chopped green peppers
1 teaspoon minced garlic
1 ( 10 3/4-ounce can ) condensed cream of mushroom soup
1 ( 14 1/2-ounce can ) diced tomatoes with liquid
3/4 cup shredded cheddar cheese
3/4 teaspoon seasoning salt
1 (2.8-ounce) can french fried onions
recipeText:
Cook noodles as directed on package; drain.

Ground brown beef with green pepper and garlic until beef is browned and pepper is tender; drain.

Combine noodles, beef mixture, soup, tomatoes, cheese and salt into a greased 2-qt casserole dish.

Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 30 - 40 minutes.  Uncover, top with french-fried onions and bake 5 minutes longer.

recipeName: Crunchy Kefta Rolls - Moroccan - spiced ground beef
recipeDescription:
Tamara's Rad-dish recipe.  
Flaky fillo dough with Kefta (Moroccan spiced ground beef)
ingredientList:
8 sheets Fillo (Phyllo) Dough (find in freezer section)
1/2 pound ground beef
1/3 cup golden raisins
1 tablespoon tomato paste
3/4 teaspoon salt
3/4 teaspoon cumin
1/2 teaspoon cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon coriander
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 cup water
4 tablespoons butter
recipeText:
Thaw fillo dough according to package directions.
Preheat oven to 400 degrees.  Line baking sheet with parchment paper.

Cook ground beef with all ingredients except butter and dough.  Set aside and allow to cool slightly.

Melt butter. 

Prepare fillo dough.  Pick up two sheets of fillo together and lay out on cutting board.  Use pastry brush and lightly coat top with butter.
Use a pizza cutter or knife to cut dough into 4 equal rectangles.

Add 1 heaping TBSP beef filling to one end of each piece.
Roll dough into a tube and gently pinch the ends to seal.  Set on baking sheet.

Repeat with remaining dough to create 16 rolls.  Brush tops of rolls with remaining butter.

Bake until lightly browned, 12 - 15 minutes. 

Serve immediately.

ingredientList:
1 pound Jimmy Dean Hot Sausage, brown and drain
9 eggs, beaten
3 cups milk
4 slices bread, cubed
1 1/2 cups shredded Cheddar cheese
1 1/2 teaspoons dry mustard
1 teaspoon salt
2 tablespoons dried minced onion
recipeText:
Put browned sausage in the bottom of a 9"x13" pan.  Sprinkle with cheese and onion flakes.  Cover with bread.
In a separate bowl, mix egg , milk, mustard, and salt.  Pour mixture over the bread.

Bake at 350 degrees for 40-45 minutes.

ingredientList:
3 cups cooked white rice (day old rice works best)
3 tablespoons sesame oil
1 cup frozen peas and carrots, thawed
1 small onion, chopped
2 teaspoons minced garlic
2 eggs, slightly beaten
1/4 cup soy sauce
recipeText:
On medium high heat, heat the oil in a large skillet or wok. Add the peas/carrots mix, onion and garlic. Stir fry until tender.

Lower the heat to medium low and push the mixture off to one side, then pour your eggs on the other side of skillet and stir fry until scrambled. 

Now add the rice and soy sauce and blend all together well. Stir fry until thoroughly heated!

ingredientList:
3 cans Pillsbury buttermilk refrigerator biscuits (10 ct)
60 slices pepperoni (2 per biscuit)
Multi-cheese shredded cheese
1 egg, beaten
1/4 cup parmesan cheese
Italian seasoning
Garlic powder
1 jar pizza sauce
recipeText:
Flatten each biscuit and stack pepperoni and shredded cheese on top.

Gather edges of biscuit and secure on top of the roll. 

Line rolls in greased 9x13 pan Brush with beaten egg. 

Sprinkle with parmesan cheese, Italian seasoning and garlic powder. 

Bake at 425 degrees F. for 18 to 20 mins. Serve with warm pizza sauce for dipping.

recipeDescription:
Sheet Pan Garlic Butter Baked Salmon with crispy potatoes, asparagus and a garlic butter sauce with a touch of lemon. 
A complete meal on one tray using minimal ingredients you already have in your kitchen! Full of flavour and so easy to make!
ingredientList:
1 pound fingerling potatoes, halved (or Yukon golds or halved white/red baby potatoes)
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 1/2 teaspoons salt, divided
1/2 teaspoon cracked black pepper, divided
4 (6 oz) skinless salmon fillets
2 1/2 tablespoons minced garlic, divided
2 tablespoons fresh chopped parsley
1/3 cup freshly squeezed lemon juice
1/2 cup melted unsalted butter
3 bunches asparagus, (18 spears, woody ends removed)
2 tablespoons dry white wine (substitute with 1/4 cup low-sodium chicken broth)
1 lemon sliced to garnish
recipeText:
Heat oven to 400 degrees F. 

On a large rimmed baking sheet, toss together potatoes with the oil, 1/2 tablespoon of garlic, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper. 

Spread out in an even layer and roast for 15 minutes until they're just starting to soften and brown.

Push potatoes to one side of the sheet pan and arrange salmon down the center. 

Rub salmon evenly with 1 1/2 tablespoons of the minced garlic and 2 tablespoons of parsley. 
Add the asparagus to the other side of the pan. 

Combine 1/4 cup of lemon juice and 1/4 cup of the melted butter together and pour the mixture over the salmon and asparagus. Season everything with the remaining salt and pepper.

Return to oven and continue baking until the potatoes are golden and fork-tender and the salmon is opaque throughout, (about 10 minutes). Optional: broil in the last 2 minutes for charred edges. 

Meanwhile, in a small bowl, combine the remaining butter, garlic and lemon juice with the wine (or chicken stock). 

Serve with the salmon, veggies and lemon slices!

ingredientList:
4 tablespoons butter
1 clove garlic, minced
3 (3/4 inch thick) slices French bread, cut into cubes
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F.

In a large saute pan, melt butter over medium heat. Stir in garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute. Add bread cubes, and toss to coat. Spread on a baking sheet.

Bake for 15 minutes, or until crisp and dry. Check frequently to prevent burning. Cool.

ingredientList:
3 tablespoons salt
1 tablespoon garlic powder
recipeText: Mix together.

ingredientList:
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix
1/2 cup butter
2 French bread, cut in half lengthwise
recipeText:
Soften butter and stir in dressing mix.  

Spread on bread.

Grill or broil until golden.

ingredientList:
4 (3-5 ounces each) Delta Pride catfish fillets
1/2 cup oil
1/2 cup lemon juice
1 (.6 ounce) package zesty Italian dressing
1 teaspoon seasoned salt
recipeText:
Rinse fillets and blot dry. Combine remaining ingredients in flat casserole dish or large plastic zipper bag. 

Add fillets and marinate in refrigerator overnight, turning several times. 

Grill fillets over medium-hot coals for 5-8 minutes on each side or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork. Baste with marinade while cooking.


Oven method:
Broil 6 inches from heat for 5-6 minutes. Turn carefully and baste with marinade. Broil an additional 5-6 minutes or until fish flakes easily when tested with a fork.

ingredientList:
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix
1/3 cup lemon juice
3 tablespoons olive oil
3 tablespoons white wine or water
1 1/2 pounds white fish fillets
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients, except fish, in a shallow dish.  Add fish and coat all sides with mixture.  Cover and refrigerate for 15 - 30 minutes.  

Remove fish from marinade.  

Broil 9 - 12 minutes or until fish begins to flake.

recipeDescription: Tamara's Rad-ish Recipe.
ingredientList:
1 small onion
1 green bell pepper
2 stalks celery
3 cloves garlic
12 large, cooked shrimp
8 ounces fully-cooked smoked sausages
2 teaspoons paprika
1/2 teaspoon oregano
1/2 teaspoon thyme
1 1/2 cups long grain rice
3 cups chicken broth
1 15-ounce can crushed tomatoes
recipeText:
Heat skillet.  Fry onion in a bit of oil.
Add all ingredients except shrimp.  Cook fully until rice is tender.
Add shrimp until fully heated.

Serve.

recipeName: Lemon-Garlic Sheet-Pan Salmon with Potatoes & Green Beans
ingredientList:
1.5 pounds baby Yukon Gold potatoes, scrubbed and halved or quartered
3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil, divided
1 teaspoon salt, divided
¾ teaspoon pepper, divided
2 tablespoons lemon juice
4 small cloves garlic, finely chopped (about 1 tablespoon)
1 tablespoon chopped fresh dill, plus more for garnish
4 (5-ounce) skinless salmon fillets
1 (8-ounce) package trimmed haricots verts or thin green beans (about 4 cups)
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 400°F. 

Line a large rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper. Toss potatoes, 1 tablespoon oil, ½ teaspoon salt and ¼ teaspoon pepper together on the prepared baking sheet until coated; spread into an even layer. 

Roast until the potatoes begin to soften and brown, about 20 minutes.

Meanwhile, whisk 2 tablespoons lemon juice, the chopped garlic, 1 tablespoon dill and the remaining 2 tablespoons oil and ½ teaspoon each salt and pepper together in a small bowl.

Push the potatoes to one side of the pan. 

Arrange 4 salmon fillets and 4 cups thin green beans in an even layer in the empty space. Brush half of the lemon juice mixture (about 2 tablespoons) over the salmon; drizzle the remaining mixture over the beans. 

Roast until the potatoes are fork-tender, the beans are tender-crisp and the salmon flakes easily with a fork, about 15 minutes. Garnish with additional dill, if desired.

ingredientList:
Low Fat Zucchini Stuffed Chicken
2 tablespoons margarine
2 medium zucchini, shredded
3 slices bread
1 egg white
1 teaspoon butter oil
1/2 cup shredded, low fat Swiss cheese
8 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
Dash pepper
Dash paprika
recipeText:
Melt margarine in a skillet and saute zucchini several minutes over medium-high heat. Tear the bread into pieces and add to zucchini, along with egg white, butter oil, and cheese. Stir well and remove from heat. 

Season chicken breasts with spices. Put chicken breasts in casserole dish sprayed with cooking spray. Spread stuffing over chicken. 

Cover and bake at 400 degrees for approximately 1 hour or until chicken is tender.

ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1/2 cup oats
1 1/2 teaspoons salt, divided
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon celery salt
1 teaspoon parsley flakes
2 ( 10 3/4-ounce can ) condensed cream of asparagus soup
2 cups water
1 cup uncooked rice
1 1/2 cups sliced celery
1 large onion, chopped
4-ounce can mushroom pieces, undrained
recipeText:
In bowl, combine beef, oats, 1/2 tsp. salt, pepper, celery salt, and parsley.  Shape into meatballs.

Place on a greased baking sheet.  Bake at 400 degrees for 18 - 20 minutes or until browned.

Meanwhile, combine rice, celery, onion, mushrooms, soup, water, and 1 tsp. salt.

Transfer meatballs to a greased casserole dish; pour soup mixture over.  

Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 1 hour or until liquid is absorbed and rice is tender.

recipeDescription: This recipe could hardly be simpler to prepare. The chicken gets a wonderful tangy taste, and no one will know you used convenient ingredients like a bottle of salad dressing and onion soup mix...unless you tell them.
ingredientList:
1 (16-fluid ounce) bottle Russian or Catalina salad dressing
2/3 cup apricot preserves
2 envelopes dry onion soup mix
16 boneless skinless chicken breast halves
Hot cooked rice
recipeText:
In a bowl, combine dressing, preserves and soup mix. Place chicken in two ungreased 11-in. x 7-in. x 2-in. baking pans; top with dressing mixture. 

Cover and bake at 350 degrees for 20 minutes; baste. 

Bake, uncovered, 20 minutes longer or until chicken juices run clear. Serve over rice.

ingredientList:
One 8-ounce bar Cabot Pepper Jack Cheese, shredded
1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 tablespoon unsalted butter
1/2 large onion, diced (about 1/2 cup)
1/4 teaspoon black pepper
1/4 teaspoon ground cumin
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt, or more to taste
2 cloves garlic, minced
One 12-ounce can evaporated milk
Chopped cilantro, for serving
Tortilla chips, for serving
recipeText:
Toss the shredded cheese with the cornstarch; set aside.

Place the butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat; add the onion, pepper, cumin, and salt, and cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions start to soften and become translucent, about 4 minutes.

Add the garlic and cook for 1 minute more. Add the milk and bring to a simmer.

A handful at a time, add the cheese to the saucepan, stirring after each addition until melted. Let the queso simmer for 2 to 3 minutes. 

Taste the dip (caution - it's hot!) and adjust for seasoning (be careful with salt because tortilla chips are usually already pretty salty).

Transfer the queso to a bowl. Top with some cilantro and serve with tortilla chips for dipping.

ingredientList:
1/4 cup butter, melted
1 tablespoon dried parsley flakes
1 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon garlic salt
1 loaf frozen white bread dough, thawed
recipeText:
In a small bowl, combine the butter, parsley, garlic powder and garlic salt. Cut dough into 1-in. pieces; dip into butter mixture. Layer in a greased 9x5-in. loaf pan. 

Cover and let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.

Bake at 350 degrees for 30 minutes or until golden brown.

recipeDescription: Breakfast or dessert
ingredientList:
6 tablespoons ground flax
2 cups milk
2 tablespoons ground hazelnuts
1 banana
1 tablespoon honey
Juice from one orange
1 apple, peeled, cored, and diced
recipeText:
Bring milk to a boil and stir in the flax.  Boil for 30 seconds.  Remove from heat, pour into a bowl, and let cool.
The mixture will have the consistency of pudding.

Add nuts, banana, hone, and orange juice.  Wisk vigorously or blend on low in a blender.

Fold in apples and serve.

When used as a dessert, top with whipping cream or strawberries.

Variations include dried fruits and raisins, and pineapple.

ingredientList:
2 cups low-sodium chicken broth
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon tomato paste
One 1-ounce package dry onion soup mix
Kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper
8 ounces button mushrooms, quartered
6 boneless, skinless chicken thighs (about 1 3/4 pounds)
12 ounces egg noodles
4 tablespoons butter, cut into pieces
4 ounces cream cheese, at room temperature 
Chopped fresh parsley, for serving
recipeText:
Whisk together the broth, flour, tomato paste, onion soup mix, 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper in a medium bowl until combined. Add to a 6-quart slow cooker and top with the mushrooms and chicken. 

Cover and cook on high for 4 hours.

When ready to serve, bring a large pot of water to a boil; salt the water generously. 

Add the noodles and cook until al dente according to the package directions. Drain and toss in a large bowl with the butter until the butter is melted and the noodles are completely coated. 

Transfer the chicken to a small bowl and shred with 2 forks. Whisk the cream cheese into the sauce until completely incorporated; stir in the chicken and noodles. Top with parsley before serving.

ingredientList:
2 1/2 tablespoons smoked paprika
9 tablespoons ground cumin
1 1/2 tablespoons garlic powder
2 1/2 tablespoons chipotle or chili powder
2 1/2 tablespoons dried cilantro
5 tablespoons onion powder
2 1/2 tablespoons sugar
4 tablespoons kosher salt
recipeText:
Combine ingredients in Dry Storage Containers seal, and shake to combine. Store up to 6 months. Shake before using.

Store up to 6 months. Adds delicious spice to chicken fish pork and veggies. Also makes a fun gift for the holidays.

ingredientList:
1 cup fresh basil
1 tablespoon pine nuts
1 fresh tomato
1 clove garlic
1 - 2 tablespoons olive oil
4 salmon fillets
Broccoli
recipeText:
In a blender, combine all ingredients except salmon and broccoli.  Blend until smooth.

Put a steamer backed in a saucepan.  Add water to about half an inch below the bottom of the steamer basket.  Bring the water to a boil, put a filet of salmon or sole in the steamer.  Cover and steam until tender, usually about 5 minutes.

While the fish is steaming, chop the broccoli and steam or cook in microwave.

Spoon the pesto over the fish and broccoli and serve.   Can also serve with rice.

recipeDescription: From our 4th grade cookbook.  Contributed by Mrs. Alwin.
ingredientList:
1 cup seasoned stuffing mix
1/3 cup water
3 tablespoons melted butter
1/2 cup onions, chopped
1 pound ground beef
1/3 cup evaporated milk
1 can cream of mushroom soup or cream of chicken soup
2 tablespoons Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon catsup
recipeText:
Mix stuffing mix, water, butter, and onions.

In a separate bowl, mix the ground beef and evaporated milk.  Make 4 flat patties on wax paper. 

Divide the stuffing mix in 4 and place on top of patty.  Form into balls or small loaves by wrapping meat around the stuffing.  Place in a baking dish.

Mix the soup, Worcestershire sauce, and catsup.  Pour over the meatballs.  Bake uncovered 60 minutes at 350 degrees.  Baste with sauce once about 5 minutes before removing from the oven.

ingredientList: http://www.deltapride.com/recipes.htm

1 1/2 cups chopped tomatoes (6 - 8 tomatoes)
2 tablespoons diced red onions
1 clove garlic, minced
2 tablespoons fresh basil
2 tablespoons olive oil
1/2 teaspoon red wine vinegar
1/4 teaspoon salt
Dash pepper
1/2 loaf French bread or crusty Italian bread (5-7 slices)
1/2 teaspoon garlic salt
2 sprigs parsley
recipeText:
Combine the tomatoes, red onion, garlic, and basil in a medium bowl.

Add 1/2 TBSP of oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper, mix well.  Cover the bowl and let it sit in the refrigerator for at least 1 hour.

When you are ready to serve the dish, preheat your broiler and slice the baguette in 1-inch slices on a 45-degree angle to make 5 slices of bread.

Combine the remaining 1 1/2 TBSP of oil with the garlic salt.

Brush the entire surface of each slice of bread (both sides) with the olive oil mixture.  Broil the slices of bread in the oven for 1 1/2 to 2 minutes per side or until the surface of bread starts to brown.

Arrange the bread like a star or spokes of a wheel on a plate.  Pour the chilled tomato mixture in a neat pile onto the bread slices where they meet at the center of the plate.  Garnish with parsley.

recipeDescription: Ken would eat this four times a year.
ingredientList:
1 small zucchini, chopped (1 cup)
1 large tomato, chopped (1 cup)
1 medium onion, chopped (1/2 cup)
1/3 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/2 cup Original Bisquick
1 cup milk
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
2 eggs
recipeText:
1. Heat oven to 400 degrees. Grease pie plate, 9 x 1 1/4 inches. Layer zucchini, tomato, onion and cheese in pie plate.

2. Stir remaining ingredients until blended. Pour into pie plate.

3. Bake about 35 minutes or until knife inserted in center comes out clean. Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

HIGH ALTITUDE (3500 to 6500 feet): Use 3/4 cup Bisquick. Bake 35 to 40 minutes.

NEXT TIME: TRY USING LESS MILK (PLENTY OF LIQUID IN VEGGIES) AND ADD CHEDDAR CHEESE AND GARLIC TO DOUGH

ingredientList:
2 pounds white cabbage, core removed and shredded (10 cups)
1 1/2 tablespoons extra virgin olive oil
1 tablespoon garlic, minced
1 pinch crushed red pepper flakes
1/2 teaspoon fine sea salt
1/2 lemon, cut into wedges
recipeText:
To shred the cabbage, quarter the cabbage through the core, and then cut out the core. 
Cut each quarter crosswise in half and finely shred. Rinse and spin or pat very dry.

Heat the olive oil in a large skillet or Dutch oven over medium-high heat. 

Add the cabbage, garlic, red pepper flakes, and the salt. It might seem like too much cabbage for the pan, but as it cooks, the cabbage will wilt down.

Cook, stirring occasionally until the cabbage is tender and some of the cabbage begins to turn a light brown; 10 to 15 minutes.

Squeeze the juice from 2 lemon wedges over the cabbage. Taste then adjust with more salt, pepper, and lemon juice as needed.


Note: This cabbage recipe is excellent with onions, add them to the pan at the same time as the cabbage.

ingredientList:
1 1/2 cups corkscrew pasta
2 medium carrots, sliced
1 cup broccoli flowerets
1 can condensed cheddar cheese soup
1/2 cup milk
1 tablespoon mustard
recipeText:
In large saucepan prepare macaroni according to package directions. 

Add carrots and broccoli for last 5 minutes of cooking time. Drain.

In same pan mix soup, milk, mustard and macaroni mixture.

Heat through, stirring often.

ingredientList:
4 large tomatoes
4 tablespoons butter
1 1/2 teaspoons dried oregano
1 teaspoon minced garlic
Pinch pepper
Pinch salt
2 tablespoons grated Parmesan cheese
recipeText:
Cut the tomatoes in half horizontally and place in a shallow flameproof dish.

Beat the butter with the oregano, garlic, pepper, salt and Parmesan in a bowl. Spread the mixture over the cut side of each tomato.

Broil the tomatoes under medium heat for about 5 minutes until the topping is just turning golden.

ingredientList:
6 medium potatoes, peeled
8 ounces shredded Cheddar cheese
10 3/4 ounces cream of chicken soup
1/4 cup butter, melted
2 tablespoons water
8 ounces sour cream
3 ounces French's French Fried Onions
recipeText:
Cut potatoes in 1-inch strips.  Toss potatoes with a little salt and pepper plus 2 cups cheese.  Place in slow cooker.

Combine soup, melted butter and 2 TBSP water in a saucepan and heat just enough to pour over potato mixture.  

Cover and cook on LOW for 6 to 8 hours or until potatoes are tender.

Stir in sour cream and remaining cheese.

When ready to serve, sprinkle onion rings over top of potatoes.

ingredientList:
1 tablespoon extra virgin olive oil
1 onion, finely chopped
2 cloves minced garlic
1 1/2 cups chopped, cleaned portobello or shiitake mushrooms
2 1/4 cups vegetable broth
3 tablespoons reduced-sodium soy sauce
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/8 teaspoon dried sage
1 tablespoon cornstarch
2 tablespoons water
Dash pepper
recipeText:
Heat oil in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Add onion and garlic. Cook until softened. Add mushrooms and cook until they begin to release their juices, about 10 minutes.

Add broth, soy sauce, thyme and sage; simmer for 10 minutes. 

Mix cornstarch and water in a small bowl.  Stir into the sauce and simmer, stirring often, about 10 minutes or until slightly thickened.  Season with pepper.  Serve hot.

ingredientList:
5-6 potatoes peeled, sliced into 1/4" discs
1 pound ground beef
2 teaspoons garlic powder
1 dash pepper
1 dash salt
1/4 cup flour
2 cups milk
1/2 cup sour cream
1 dash dill
1 dash parsley flakes
recipeText:
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add potatoes and boil until tender, about 7-8 minutes. Drain and set aside while you make the rest of the meal.

In a large skillet, brown ground beef, breaking up with a wooden spoon. Season with garlic powder, salt and pepper.

Stir in flour until beef is well coated. Gradually add in milk, stirring constantly. Stir until sauce thickens up, about 4-5 minutes.

Stir in sour cream, potatoes, dill and parsley plus more salt & pepper. 

Serve topped with fresh dill & parsley.

recipeName: Roasted Brussel Sprouts with Carmelized Pancetta
ingredientList:
1 1/2 pounds shredded brussels sprouts (about 9 cups)
1/2 cup extra virgin olive oil
3 large garlic cloves, minced
1 1/2 teaspoons kosher salt
3/4 teaspoon pepper
4 dried ancho or guajillo chiles (1/2 oz. each), stemmed and cut into this strip or rings
12 ounces pancetta, cut into small cubes
6 tablespoons packed light brown sugar
1 1/2 teaspoons finely chopped fresh thyme
recipeText:
1. Preheat oven to 400°. 
Toss together brussels sprouts, olive oil, garlic, salt and pepper on a large rimmed baking sheet. 
Bake in preheated oven until brussels sprouts are slightly browned, 10 to 12 minutes. 
Add chiles to baking sheet; toss with brussels sprouts using tongs. Continue baking until chiles are fragrant and crisp, 5 to 6 minutes longer.

2. Meanwhile, place pancetta and brown sugar in a large saucepan over medium-high heat. 
Cook, stirring often, until pancetta is cooked through and fat has rendered, 5 to 6 minutes. 
Transfer the mixture to a large baking sheet; let cool about 3 minutes. Stir in chopped thyme.

3. Transfer brussels sprouts mixture to a large serving bowl. Add pancetta mixture; toss to combine well. Serve warm or at room temperature.

ingredientList:
1 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, diced
1 teaspoon minced garlic
1 can cream of chicken soup
1 jar sauerkraut
1 box egg noodles, cooked
recipeText:
Heat oven to 350° F. 

Fry diced onion. Add garlic and ground beef.  Cook fully.

Mix in soup, sauerkraut, and egg noodles.

Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 20 minutes.

recipeDescription: Tamara's Spaghetti Squash Toss
ingredientList:
1 medium to large spaghetti squash
2 tsp olive oil (I also use grapeseed oil)
2 cloves minced garlic
1/4 cup diced green onion
1 can diced tomatoes - drained well
1 cup fresh diced mushrooms
1 tsp basil
1 tsp oregano
1 tsp parsley
1/2 tsp salt (or to taste)
1/2 tsp ground black pepper (or to taste)*
1/4 cup of parmesan and/or romano cheese
*For a spicier option toss in 1/4 tsp red pepper flakes

Optional - garnish with chopped fresh herbs and toasted pine nuts
recipeText:
To prepare spaghetti squash:

Use a sharp knife, cut the squash in half lengthwise. Using a spoon, remove the seeds and discard. Place squash cut side up, in a baking dish.

Add enough water to come 1/2-inch up the sides of the baking dish and cover the top with clear plastic wrap

Microwave on high for 10-15 minutes or until the squash is easily pierced with a knife. If squash is still undercooked turn it over, face down in dish and cover with wrap again. Continue to cook another 5-7 minutes, until the squash is very tender.

Remove and, uncover. Allow to cool slightly. Using a fork, gently pull the strands of squash away from the peel and place the squash strands into a large bowl.

Warm large skillet on stove. Add olive oil and heat. Add garlic and cook stirring contantly for about 30 seconds. Add diced mushrooms and green onion and cook until juices run from mushrooms and they are glazed.

Add cooked spaghetti squash and stir to mix mushrooms and onions. Add diced tomatoes and spices. Toss as you cook so everything is mixed thoroughly. Let simmer for about 5 minutes.

ingredientList:
2 pounds ground beef
1/2 medium onion, chopped
6 cups water
8 beef bouillon cubes
2 28-ounce cans diced tomatoes, with liquid
2 cups cooked rice
2 teaspoons salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon paprika
3 green, yellow, or red peppers, seeded and chopped
recipeText:
Cook ground beef with onion until the meat is brown and onion is tender; drain.

Add water, bouillon, tomatoes, rice, and seasonings. 

Bring to boil; reduce heat and simmer covered for 1 hour.

Add chopped peppers; cook uncovered for 10 - 15 minutes or just until tender.

recipeDescription: From Nancy D.
ingredientList:
4 eggs
2 cups sugar
1 cup vegetable oil
3 1/2 cups flour
1 1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1 1/2 teaspoons salt
1 1/2 teaspoons cinnamon
3/4 teaspoon baking powder
2 cups grated zucchini
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 cup chopped nuts
recipeText:
Mix all ingredients together.  Split dough into two greased and floured bread pans.
 
Bake at 350 degrees for 55 minutes.

ingredientList:
1 package frozen spinach
1 jar artichoke hearts
1/3 cup mayonnaise
1/3 cup sour cream
1 1/4 cups shredded Parmesan cheese
1/2 package dry Italian salad dressing mix
recipeText:
Dry and squeeze spinach to remove as much water as possible.

Drain artichokes and break into smaller pieces. Blend with
spinach. Mix together mayonnaise, sour cream, 1 cup cheese,
and dry salad dressing. Blend mixture with spinach and
artichokes. Spread in square baking pan. Top with remaining
1/4 cup of cheese.

Bake at 350 degrees for 15-20 minutes, until top cheese is
golden brown.

Serve in stuffed mushrooms, on cucumber slices, tortillas or
low carb crackers.

ingredientList:
1 lb. zucchini squash
1 egg
2 tbsp. milk
1 c. dry bread crumbs
Oil for frying
1/2 c. grated cheese (Romano)
1/4 c. parsley flakes
1 clove garlic, minced
recipeText:
Beat egg and add milk. More milk may be used, if needed. Set this aside. 

Combine bread crumbs, cheese, parsley and minced garlic. This is coating used for squash. 

Wash and scrape zucchini. Slice lengthwise into 4-5 slices, depending on size. 

Dip slices in egg mixture, then into seasoning coating. Fry in hot oil until done. 

*The seasoning bread crumb coating may be used for coating pork chops or chicken, also.

ingredientList:
2 slices thick-cut bacon, cut into 1" pieces
2 cloves garlic, smashed
1 pound brussels sprouts, trimmed and halved
1/2 teaspoon kosher salt, plus more for serving
1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, plus more for serving
1/2 teaspoon black pepper, plus more for serving
1/4 cup Truvia Sweet Complete Brown Sweetener
1 teaspoon bourbon whiskey
recipeText:
1. In a large skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crispy, 5 to 6 minutes. 
Transfer bacon to a plate using a slotted spoon. 
Pour off all but 4 tablespoons bacon fat from the skillet.

2. Return skillet to medium heat. Add garlic and Brussels sprouts cut-side down. Let cook, undisturbed, until bottoms are golden and edges are crispy, 5 to 6 minutes. 
Add salt, paprika, and pepper, and continue to cook, stirring occasionally, until sprouts are golden all over and tender, 4 to 5 minutes more.

3. Stir in sweetener and bourbon and cook until thick and syrupy, 2 to 3 minutes. 
Return bacon to skillet and toss to coat.

4. Sprinkle with more salt, paprika, and pepper to taste, if desired, and serve.

ingredientList:
8 Roma (plum) tomatoes, diced
1/3 cup chopped fresh basil
1/4 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 tablespoon balsamic vinegar
1 teaspoon olive oil
1/4 teaspoon kosher salt
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
1 loaf French bread, toasted and sliced
recipeText:
In a bowl, toss together the tomatoes, basil, Parmesan cheese, and garlic. Mix in the balsamic vinegar, olive oil, kosher salt, and pepper. 

Let sit 1-2 hours in fridge before serving.

Serve on toasted bread slices.

ingredientList:
1 lg egg, beaten
1/3 cup low-fat milk
1 cup flour
salt and pepper, to taste
6 zucchini, cut steak fry-style
1 cup olive oil, or canola oil
recipeText:
In a bowl, mix egg, milk, flour, salt and pepper until smooth. If too thick, add water. If too thin, add flour. Dip zucchini in batter.

Deep fry in hot oil. Serve with tomato sauce.

ingredientList:
5 slices bacon
3 tablespoons butter
2 small shallots, minced
2 pounds brussels sprouts, halved
kosher salt
1/2 teaspoon cayenne pepper
3/4 cup heavy cream
1/2 cup shredded sharp white Cheddar cheese
1/2 cup shredded gruyére cheese
recipeText:
Preheat oven to 375°. In a large oven-safe skillet over medium heat, cook bacon until crispy, 8 minutes. 
Drain on a paper towel-lined plate, then chop. Discard bacon fat. 

Return skillet to medium heat and melt butter. Add shallots and Brussels sprouts and season with salt and cayenne. 
Cook, stirring occasionally, until tender, about 10 minutes. 

Remove from heat and drizzle with heavy cream, then top with both cheeses and bacon. 

Bake until cheese is bubbly, 12 to 15 minutes. (If your cheese isn't golden, switch oven to broil and broil 1 minute.)

recipeDescription:
Tamara's Recipe from Rad-dish.
50 - 60 minutes to make.
ingredientList:
1 small onion
1 large carrot
1 large zucchini
2 cloves garlic
8 basil leaves
1/2 pound ground beef
1 teaspoon dried oregano
2 tablespoons tomato paste
1 - 15 ounces can diced tomatoes
6 cups vegetable broth
8 dried lasagna noodles
1 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
recipeText:
Cook meat and drain grease.  Set aside.

Cook vegetables until soft, about 10 minutes.  

Crush noodles.  Mix all ingredients together and cook until noodles are done.

Serve.

ingredientList:
1 packet Hidden Valley Ranch Dressing Mix
2 pounds small red potatoes, quartered
1/4 cup vegetable oil
recipeText:
Place potatoes in plastic bag and add oil.  Toss to coat.  

Add dressing mix and toss again until coated.  

Bake on ungreased baking pan at 450 degrees for 35 minutes.

recipeDescription: From Ardella
ingredientList:
1 pound Jimmy Dean Sausage
1/2 cup green peppers
1/2 cup chopped onions
1 can tomato soup
1 cup cream of chicken soup
3/4 cup water
1/2 teaspoon basil
1/2 teaspoon garlic
3/4 teaspoon oregano
8 ounces egg noodles
1 cup mozzarella cheese
8 ounces pepperoni
recipeText:
Brown and drain sausage, green pepper, and onion.  Add soups, water, and spices.  

Cook and drain noodles.

Combine sauce & noodles in casserole dish.  Sprinkle with cheese and layer pepperoni on top. 
 
Bake covered at 350 degrees for 30 minutes.  Uncover and bake an additional 15 minutes.

recipeDescription:
Melissa and Ken loved it.  Kailey doesn't like mac and cheese.
Dylan likes cheddar mac better.
ingredientList:
1/2 pound large pasta shells
2 tablespoons butter
2 tablespoons flour
2 cups milk
1 pound pepper jack cheese
1 - 2 jalapeno chiles thinly sliced
Salt and pepper, to taste
recipeText:
Set oven to 350 degrees F

Cook the pasta in plenty of salted water just until al dente. Drain and set aside.

Melt the butter in a large pan and add the flour. Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, for a minute or so. 

Add the milk and stir or whisk until well combined. Cook, stirring constantly, until the mixture thickens. 

Remove from the heat and add the cheese, a little at a time, while stirring, until all the cheese has been incorporated and the sauce is smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Stir the cooked pasta into the sauce, along with the sliced jalapenos and mix well.
